messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:27): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: don't make the switch, man
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (19:27): so... what do you know that I don't know :-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:28): nothing... I know nothing.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:28): (like the dude on Hogan's Heroes)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:28): Hmm, shipping versions of Fedora have beta versions of Firefox? That doesn't sound like an excellent idea for stability
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (19:28): Ubuntu did that for Firefox 2 IIRC.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:29): That doesn't sound like an excellent idea for stability either
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:29): though I thought it was for FF3?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:29): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: fedora doesn't seem to care much about stability
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:29): which had some nasty fsync bug on Linux, that all the Ubuntu users were exposed to
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (19:29): might have been 3
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:29): or something like that

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:30): is happy to stick with Gentoo, where there's no temptation to mark a package as stable prematurely just to avoid having to delay it a year until the next release
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (19:32): releases are every six months for Ubuntu (and apparently for Fedora)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:32): s/a year/six months/ then :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:36): grumbles at finding the suitcase he was going to use has a mass of 12kg, which with Ryanair's limit of 15kg is problematic
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:38): Fortunately 12 < 15
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (19:38): is your suitcase made of wood?
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (19:38): somewhat like a clog, carved from a single scots pine
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:39): You could fill the suitcase with helium to reduce its weight (which is what really matters)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:40): I don't think gas containers are allowed
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:41): I think it's kind of hard to have a container that doesn't contain gas, unless it contains a vacuum
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:41): (or a liquid, but that's certainly not allowed)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:42): I don't think you'll get through airport security with dictionary definitions
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:42): No, seriously, how do you have a 12kg suitcase?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:42): Or does it have stuff in?
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (19:42): perhaps it has hidden compartments stuffed full of narcotics
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:43): In hich case you haven't deined the problem well enough
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (19:43): but i like to imagine it's made of wood
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:43): It's lined with osmium

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:44): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: It won't matter anyway because after your bag has been weighed, the security people can open it up to search for illicit contents and the helium gas will disperse harmlessly and invisibly
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:44): although the security people might start speaking in high-pitched voices which would give the game away
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:44): And then you'd get sued for emotional distress too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:46): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I can't work that out.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:46): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: There's nothing in it.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:46): Fill it with hydrogen, and then it'll be much safer
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:46): :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:46): since that has less obvious effects than helium
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:46): What happens if the security people smoke?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:46): unless the security people are smokers, in which case they clearly deserve what they get
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:46): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: You have a suitcase that, when empty, has a mass of 12kg?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:46): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Yes.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:47): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Oh, you beat me :-(
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:47): That is insane
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Is smoking in a public place indoors illegal in England nowadays?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:47): Or at least not designed for air travel
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:47): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Yes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:48): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: WTF does said suitcase date from, and wtf was its intended purpose?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:48): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: A couple of years ago, dunno.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:48): Perhaps it was designed for carrying radioactive devices?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:49): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Well, it'd leak a lot of radiation even with its weight
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:49): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Sounds like a reasonable theory
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:49): (As it doesn't appear to be made of lead, though I expect it would stop alpha and beta radiation‚Ä¶ but I expect most suitcases would)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:53): Well that's alright then
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:53): 3kg should be more than enough for anyone
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (19:57): 12kg for a suitcase is indeed impressive
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:58): Most laptops only weigh 2kg (or less) anyhow
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:00): You could remove the keys that aren't very useful, like ` and F6, to save more weight
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:01): my macbook is 2kg and it's pretty light
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:02): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: That would be relevant if I had a keyboard in the hold.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:02): finds a slightly larger case weighing 8kg
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:02): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: You still upstairs or you have got internet wherever you are residing now?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:03): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Surely you can find a bag that weighs < 2kg?

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:04): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Seemingly not.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:04): has internet in his apartment
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:04): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Well obviously the blame lies with you

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:07): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: A street whose name I cannot spell and which I have no idea how to pronounce, number 12. Friday. Dunno.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:07): (I'm going down on sleeper to London tonight, and I fly from STN on Friday)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:08): (And I come back from Link??ping via Berlin and London, so I don't get home for around two weeks after my internship ends)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:08): (So I need to pack for until then)
